article: A man was exploring caves by the seashore when he found a bag with a bunch of hardened clay balls. It waslike someone had _ the balls and left them out in the sun to bake. They didn"t look like much, but they _ the man, so he took the bag out of the cave with him. As he walkedalong the beach, he _ the clay balls one at a time out into the ocean as far as he could. He thought little about it _ he dropped one of the clay balls and it cracked open on a rock. Inside was a beautiful, preciousstone! _ , the man started breaking open the _ balls. Each contained a similar treasure. He found thousandsof dollars _ of jewels in the twenty or so leftover ones. Then it _ him. He"d been on the beach a long time, throwing maybe fifty or sixty of the balls, with their hiddentreasure, into the _ . Instead of thousands of dollars in treasure, he _ have taken home tens of thousands buthe had just thrown it away! It"s like that _ people. We look at someone, maybe even ourselves, but we _ see the clay shell. It doesn"tlook like much from the _ . It isn"t always beautiful or shining, so we _ it. We see that person as less important than someone more _ or stylish or well known or wealthy. But we haven"t taken the time to find the treasure _ inside that person. There is a treasure in each and every one of us. If we take the time to get to know that person and ask God to show us that person the _ he sees them, then the clay begins to _ and the brilliant jewel begins to shine forth. May we not come to the _ of our lives and find out that we"ve thrown away a _ in friendships because the gems were hidden in balls of clay! May we see the people in our world as God sees them.
